name: "Rock" Lyrics Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Er war ein Punker
(He was a Punker)
Und er lebte in der groen stadt
(And he lived in the big city)" 

In what song would you hear these lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Rock Me Amadeus.

	"Rock Me Amadeus" is a song by Falco. "Rock Me Amedeus" came out in 1985 by the Austrian born singer. It was Falco's only number one hit in the US and the UK. In 1998, shortly before his 41st birthday, Falco was killed in an automobile accident.

questions.text:
"Stood there boldly
Sweatin', in the sun
Felt like a million
Felt like number one
The height of summer
I'd never felt that strong" 

What song do we hear these lyrics in?
questions.explanation:
Like a Rock.

	"Like a Rock" was written by Bob Seeger. It was first performed in 1986 by Bob Seeger and The Silver Bullet Band. The song made it to number one in the US. Bob Seeger was born in 1945.

questions.text:
"At the end of a dream
If you know where I mean
When the mist just starts to clear" 

What song do we hear these lyrics in?
questions.explanation:
Long Live Rock 'n' Roll.

	"Long Live Rock 'n' Roll" is by the British band Rainbow. It was released in 1978. This song was the last to feature Ronnie James Dio, the original lead vocalist for Rainbow.

questions.text:
"Here it comes, you're never gonna top it
On a run, and no way you can stop it
Total style, perfection in decay
Running wild, flat out all the way" 

What song are these lyrics from?
options: The Golden Age of Rock 'n' Roll
questions.explanation:
You Can't Stop Rock 'n' Roll.

	"You Can't Stop Rock 'n' Roll" is a song by Twisted Sister. The song was released on June 27, 1983. It was originally released on a 12" vinyl.

questions.text:
"I was a butcher cutting up meat
My hands were bloody I'm dying on my feet
I was a surgeon 'till I start to shake
I was a falling 'till you put on the brakes" 

What song contains these lyrics?
questions.explanation:
You Got Me Rocking.

	"You Got Me Rocking" is a song by the British band The Rolling Stones. It was released in 1994 on their album "Voodoo Lounge". It is styled as a blues song with rock influence.

questions.text:
"Girl, close your eyes
Let that rhythm get into you
Don't try to fight it
There ain't nothin' that you can do
Relax your mind
Lay back and groove with mine
You got to feel that heat
And we can ride the boogie
Share that beat of love" 

From what song do we hear these lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Rock With You.

	"Rock with You" is a song by Michael Jackson on his 1979 album "Off the Wall". In the US it reached number one on the pop charts as well as the Rhythm & Blues charts. Michael Jackson was born in Gary, Indiana August 29, 1958. He died on June 25, 2009 due to cardiac arrest related to drug usage.

questions.text:
"They come from the cities
And they come from the smaller towns
Beat up cars with guitars and drummers
Goin crack boom bam" 

What song contains these lyrics?
options: There's Only One Way to Rock
questions.explanation:
R.O.C.K. in the USA

	"R.O.C.K. In the USA" was performed by John Mellencamp. Earlier in his career he was known as John Cougar Mellencamp. The song was released in 1985. John Mellencamp was born in 1951.

questions.text:
"Put your glad rags on and join me hon'
We'll have some fun when the clock strikes one" 

From what song do we get these lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Rock Around the Clock.

	"Rock Around the Clock" was released in the US in 1954 by Bill Haley and His Comets. Many consider it to be the first rock 'n' roll song. During the first season of "Happy Days", "Rock Around the Clock" was used as the theme song.

questions.text:
"You show us everything you've got
You keep on dancing and the room gets hot
You drive us wild, we'll drive you crazy" 

What song has these lyrics in them?
questions.explanation:
Rock and Roll All Nite.

	"Rock and Roll All Nite" was recorded in 1975 by KISS. While this song is a classic song now, when first released it only made it to 57 on the charts.

questions.text:
"Buddy you're a boy make a big noise
Playin' in the street gonna be a big man some day
You got mud on yo' face
You big disgrace
Kickin' your can all over the place" 

Where would you hear these lyrics?
questions.explanation:
We Will Rock You.

	"We Will Rock You" is a 1977 song by the British group Queen. It can be found on the album "News of the World". Almost always this song is followed by "We Are the Champions", although the group didn't intend for that to happen.
